org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE application of FRANCIS STEPHEN MEDCRAF for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
3038 ORDER ALLOWING APPEAL.

At a stated Term of the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, held at the court room in the City of Seattlem King County, Washington, on the 30th day of September A. D. 1915,
Present: The Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, District Judge for said District;
On motion of Geo. D. Emery Esq., solicitor and counsel for the Petitioner, appellant,IT IS ORDERED:

That an appeal to the Supreme Court of the United States from the final order, decision and judgment heretofore filed and entered herein, be, and the same is hereby allowed, and that a certified transcript of the record, exhibits and all proceedings herein be forthwith transmitted to said United States Supreme Court.

It is further ordered that the bond on appeal be fixed at the sum of two hundred fifty dollars; the same to act as a supersedeas bond and also as a bond for costs and damages on appeal. that that defe file a further supersedeas or bail bail in the sum of $500.00
Dated September 30th A.D. 1915.
ORIGINAL No.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington Northern Division
Service of within Order this 30 day of Sept 1915 and receipt of a copy thereof, admitted,
div1.ab: Frank P Helswell Attorneys for Respt
div1.p: In Re Application of F. S. Medcraf for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Order Allowing Appeal
FILED IN THE U. S. District Court, Western District of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION SEP301915
div1.ab: FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Ed M Lakin Deputy
div1.p: 2x
Geo. D. Emery Attorney for Appellant Telephone: Elliottt 4606 419 Central Building SEATTLE, WASH.
At which office they consent that service of all subsequent papers, except writs and processes, may be made upon them.
BULL BROS. "JUST PRINTERS"
